page.syntax: Filter_Expression as C = random_records(count as n[,filter as c])

argument.name: Filter_Expression
argument.description: An expression that selects records from a table.

argument.name: count
argument.description: An integer number greater than 0. The count of records to return.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (All records). A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects records from the table.

page.discussion: RANDOM_RECORDS() is a special function used only in queries to return a random number of records from the current table. If the optional Filter is supplied, the random records are selected from the records selected by the filter.

section.description: See Top, Bottom, Nth Record and Random Record Queries for more information. The following query returns 10 randomly selected orders placed after May 1, 2000.
section.example: dim tbl as P dim inx as P tbl = table.current() query.filter = "random_records(10, \"orderdate > {5/1/2000}\")" query.order = "order_total" inx = tbl.query_create() topparent.resynch()
